title: [NEW FEATURE] Timestamping management allowing synchronized network, or not.
description:
Details
Luos engine have been made for simple microcontrollers. Since version 3.0.0, Luos have been unleashed and able to run anywhere and use any network.
Historically to manage timestamping Luos was considering that no synchronization was available among the nodes. This is not true anymore because some advanced network can rely on time synchronization.
Describe the expected behavior of the feature
To be able to benefits from these synchronized network we have to be able to remove the latency based timestamping and use a plain date instead. This need to be a phy choice depending on it's capabilities.
this will be a boolean value stored in the luos_phy_t struct. This boolean will change the behavior of the Phy_ComputeMsgTimestamp, instead of computing the differential value we will just return the plain timestamp.

title: [NEW FEATURE] Multiple kind of network
description:
Multiple kind of network
Based on #428 , the multi-phy feature will allow Luos engine to deal with multiple and different networks at the same time (WiFi, CAN, Robus, …), acting like a switch. This feature will allow to deal with multiple networks on your device, multiply data bandwidth, and break the frontier between your embedded networks and your cloud or computer applications.
To allow that :

Reception context is saved in the phy side allowing parallel reception.
Phy add/remove is managed the same way services are.
Every phy have its own TX_job list (message to transmit to a target).
The node is considered as a phy (this is the localhost transportation interface)
Filtering is able to filter messages for any phy interface.
RX messages are filtered to all phy and converted into phy TX_job if needed.
No more dynamical size variability over time in messages allocation.



User point of view
This new version should not change anything on the service development side. A few API may be changed but services algorithm shouldn't change at all.
Users will have to add physical layers on the main.c the same way they are managing services (only by calling phy init).
Expected results
In the end of this project, we should have Luos services on a computer and multiple board able to exchange information and detect  each other using serial communication over USB and Robus at the same time.
All services across all network should appear as a global unified architecture in the routing table.
Tasks :

 Manage phy instanciation and dynamical phy table management
 Deal with hardware flexible node_id listing
 Deal with hardware efficient RX
 Deal with hardware efficient TX
 Simplify msg_alloc by removing reallocation.
 Move msg_alloc tasks to phy structs
 Modify luos_tasks to become localhost TX_job list.
 Deal with filtering. node_id and service_id for each phy is indexed on the phy struct.

title: [NEW FEATURE] Any kind of network support
description:
Any kind of network support
The main goal of this feature is to drastically simplify the addition of various networks’ support into the Luos engine library. Luos engine will not be limited to the Robus network layer anymore, and will be able to deal with any kind of network.
The closure of this issue will lead to the creation of a v3.0.0 release of Luos.


User point of view
This new version should not change anything on the service development side. A few API may be changed but services algorithm shouldn't change at all.
Users may have more options on the transportation layer side allowing them to choose different ones depending on there configuration.
Users can design there own transportation layer allowing to deal with custom one.
Transportation layer should be considered as kind of packages.
Expected results
In the end of this project, we should have Luos services on a computer and a board able to exchange information and detect using serial communication over USB.
Tasks :

 Move files from Robus to IO folder (msg_alloc, filtering, reception, ...)
 Rename files functions and check for unit tests
 Check for configuration files
 Add an IO init and loop functions
 Add a phy struct gathering physical layers informations
 Simplify rx msg_allocation by adding a buffer on the phy struct
 Also use buffer to manage RX treatment out of IRQ
 Add a topology IO management function
 Create phy.h function template

 Manage init / loop interface
 Manage reception interface
 Manage detection interface
 Manage transmission interface


 Create phy interface for Robus
 Unit tests of Luos V3
 Hardware test of Luos V3
 Create phy interface for serial USB

title: [NEW FEATURE] Multi-phy support
description:
Multi-phy support
Today Luos use Robus as physical transportation.
Robus is able to deal with various half-duplex physical network and have very hard real time constraints to get very efficient results and reliability on the Luos usage.
But most of the time devices have multiple different network to deal with, for example to communicate with a computer or with a specific electronic board.
The main objective of the multi-phy support is to enable the usage of any kind of network and the ability to use multiple of them regrouped under the same software architecture.


Here is the complete expected code architecture :


Step 1 : Any kind of network #428
Before thinking about how to deal with multiple physical transportation, we need to actually support different ones. So the first step goal is to make Luos work with or without Luos.
In the end of this Step, we should have Luos services on a computer and a board exchanging information using serial communication over USB.


Step 2 : Multiple kind of network #429
In Step 1 we created the support of any kind of network, but we only can use one of them. Now it's time to allow users to have multiple network.
In the end of this step, we should have Luos services on a computer exchanging information using serial communication over USB and multiple boards exchanging information using serial communication over USB with the computer service and Robus with services on other boards.


Step3 : Demonstrate it by allowing a Gate service to run on a computer or a board without any difference.
On this last step we should be able to run a Gate service application on a computer or in an electronic board without any difference (except for performances).
Project support :
This project is financially supported and motivated by 2 companies :
3Ditex       : https://www.3ditex.com
Nimbl'bot : https://nimbl-bot.com

title: [NEW FEATURE] Luos updates to be launched by Pyluos and not by Gate
description:
Before to begin
Thank you for contributing to the Luos project!
Before to begin, please ensure that the feature you are requesting doesn't exist yet (you can use the GitHub searchbar with keywords to look for other issues).
If you only have a usage question, ask it to the Luos Community.
At last, feel free to read the Luos contribution's guidelines and the documentation page to have more insight about how to contribute to Luos!
Details
Please replace the italic test by your inputs and details in each of the following sections:
What feature would you like to be included in Luos?
Updates should be initiated by a Pyluos Command and not by default in gate after the end of a detection
Describe the expected behavior of the feature
In Pyluos each time we finish a detection by default we should launch the updates in order to get the values we need of each node. Right now its the gate that does this automatically. In other cases as for example the detection launched before starting the bootloader we should not ask for updates because we should not provoke the collision of necessary messages that may harm the procedure.
What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
The first bootloader message that puts the boards in APP_RELOAD_MODE does not always arrives to every node because of unecessary updates that should not exist in that case. Anyways the gate should not ask by default for the updates. The updates when we use gate to get them are only used in high level (for example when we use pyluos) so it is on high level that we should ask the nodes to start sending them.
Thank you! Your issue will be reviewed by our admins.

description:

Thank you for contributing to the Luos project!

Details
Please replace the italic test by your inputs and details in each of the following sections:
What feature would you like to be included in Luos?
It would be nice to have a message sent from Pyluos  and Gate in order to demand each node's bootloader mode.
Describe the expected behavior of the feature
Pyluos before starting the uploading procedure should verify the bootloader mode of each node. We should be able to check that the mode is in APP_RELOAD_MODE in order to start the procedure.
What is the motivation / use case for changing the behavior?
In case that we have a busy network with a lot of messages like updates, it is possible that the first message when we want to reflash the boards is not received by the corresponding board (Collisions etc). For this reason we need to verify if the message is received and resend it if not.
Thank you! Your issue will be reviewed by our admins.

title: [NEW FEATURE] Luos engine working with low consumtion routine
description:
Luos need to works with product that not always run the execution loop of a firmware.
In low consumption product at the end of a loop a "sleep function" can be call to stop the processor and enter in low consumption mode. Often the MCU is wake by a interruption provide from a peripheral like a timer, an IO, or a reception of a byte on usart.
Luos should have in the HAL, a function to start the sleep routine to put the MCU in sleep mode and the possibility to trigger an event to wake the MCU and start the routine of going out of the sleep mode.
At the end the loop, a luos API should be call by user. this function will block the loop process, finish to treat msg and message handling calling, send a message to all service to but them in sleep mode and enter in sleep mode.
The loop process can retrieve in by a timer to wake up periodically the MCU , with the PTP by poking nodes or directly with the reception of a byte on robus

title: Use Ack information (timeout and framing error)[NEW FEATURE]
description:
an robus ackwnoledge protocol is composed by :

identifier : 0xF Always this value in case to detect a wrong byte
rx_error : CRC wrong
rx_timeout : timeout receive before ACK
rx_framing_error : flag framing error is raise during the reception (possible collision with another frame)

Only rx error is used to "ACK or NACK" a frame the two other one is just information and we should use it and maybe add a new flag for user information

title: [NEW FEATURE] Flash support for luos_engine core native HAL
description:
Until now we avoid the emulation of flash on native HAL. This means that we can't use Luos in bootloader mode on a native target.
Instead of writing binaries on a flash, we could write them on a file, then instead of jumping to another address of the flash to run the application, we could run the downloaded program.
On this native HAL instead of flash addresses, we should have files name allowing us to "jump" from one to another easily.
This could allow us to easily perform advanced test and validation on the bootloader in a native target.
This features will be really useful in the future of Luos allowing to flash computer and embedded nodes using the exact same way.

title: [NEW FEATURE] Mdns support of websocket native Pipe
description:
In Native example Pipe is the service dealing with the WebSocket and allowing other things to interact with the native luos_engine network.
For now this pipe create a WS (websocket) server and relay all input and output of the websocket to the Gate or Inspector service. This way Pyluos can send information for the Gate or Inspector trough this WS pipe.
Pyluos is able to list the compatible interfaces available on the system. For now we are able to list available serial interface, but we should be able to make it also with this WS Pipe.
To do that we should add an Mdns(also known as Bonjour) support on the native WS Pipe, allowing the WS Pipe to declare itself on the network to be "discoverable".

title: [BUG] Gate auto-update with big RTB
description:
Describe the bug
When we create a lot of auto-update at the same time all the services reply in a short period of time. But after few seconds we can see that this period of time become larger and larger. The space between boards diverge.
Network configuration

Any

How to reproduce the bug
Just use a gate with some service with the standard configuration
Additional context
The auto-update feature have a ms granularity. We could reduce this granularity to reduce this divergence.
Most importantly auto-update is computed on luos_loop(). If Luos_loop is executed later after the deadline we create divergence because after send the message we do :
new_trigger_date = current_time + update_time
We should do :
new_trigger_date = last_trigger_date + update_time

title: [BUG] Timing of the ackwnoledge with STM32F4
description:
Description of the bug
In the special case that you have an STM32F4 MCU in your network, you may have a problem with ack reception.
Indeed in all other MCU, Luos use the busy flag to say if there is a byte receiving pending. for this family, there is no busy flag!
if a byte received is pending when a timeout happens luos wait for the end of the byte before performing an end of frame. On the MCU of the F4 family, the end of frame is directly performed and the ack will not be received
How to reproduce the bug
It happen a lot when you have different MCU frequency in your network
Possible solution
change Timeout to 30*bit time.
use detect_tx pin to catch a busy line (solution already coded but not always possible depending on user HW)

description:
** Which version the bug has been detected **
Luos engine 2.6.0
Describe the bug
It's not a bug, but it's a bug for our eyes.
In all platformio projects (including other luos repos), libs are references as relative path such as ../../../.. etc...
These relative paths should be replaced by an absolute one. It will be easier to maintain.
*It was an idea of @K0rdan : thank you dude !
We could add variables in python pre-script "LUOS_ENGINE", "TOOLS_SERVICES", "WHATEVER_YOU_WANT" to point on abolute path and then use those references in platformio.ini

title: [BUG] GPIO_Pins and Interrupt initialized in examples should be changed
description:
** Which version the bug has been detected **
Luos engine 2.5.2
Describe the bug
In all the examples we define a BTN_Pin and LED_Pin that may cause problems if we want to use the same pins for something else. Erase especially in Bootloader projects.
Also, the irq handlers which are defined at stm32xxx_it.c use the gpio pins that we have defined as ptp but not the PTPA and PTPB value so, we need to include robus_hal.h and change these values to PTPA and PTPB so that it works if we redefine the pins in node_config.h

title: [BUG] Some services stop receiving messages from the Gate
description:
Which version the bug has been detected
Luos engine 2.5.2
Describe the bug
After a while (several minutes), random services on the network stop receiving messages from the Gate.
Each PCB features a LED that is lit up for one second after every command message (power_ratio) is received from the Gate. This is why I am sure that the services stop receiving commands from the Gate.
The services continue to send data to the Gate though. Each service generates non static data that is properly received by PyLuos.
Network configuration
It is the same configuration as in #308.
The image below shows the network made of one Gate + Pipe (NUCLEO-G431KB with custom shield) and 25 custom nodes (STM32G431KB based), each one hosting one custom ServoMotor service.
The Gate + Pipe are powered through the USB cable. Each motor control node is powered (12 V regulated down to 3.3 V by each PCB) through the harness visible in the middle of the image (U shape).

The Gate and Pipe are flashed with the code found in luos_engine's examples folder, only modified to match the hardware definition and the size of the network. Their node_config.h file is
#ifndef _NODE_CONFIG_H_
#define _NODE_CONFIG_H_

#define MAX_SERVICE_NUMBER 2
#define MSG_BUFFER_SIZE    12288
#define MAX_MSG_NB         128

#define TX_EN_PIN GPIO_PIN_15
#define TX_EN_PORT GPIOA

#define MAX_RTB_ENTRY            80
#define GATE_BUFF_SIZE           2048
#define PIPE_TO_LUOS_BUFFER_SIZE 2048
#define LUOS_TO_PIPE_BUFFER_SIZE 4096

#define INIT_TIME 150

#endif /* _NODE_CONFIG_H_ */
How to reproduce the bug

Set update_time of all servomotor services to 0.075 s (~13.33 Hz)
Configure all servomotor services in power mode with only rot_position as feedback
Send a power_ratio command to each servomotor, with a pause of 1 ms between each and a longer pause after the last servomotor of the network so that the update frequency matches ~13.33 Hz

Additional context

network statistics at the end of the test
monitoring the refresh_freq attribute of each PyLuos object representing a servomotor service, it appears that PyLuos continues to receive data from the Gate for all services, because all refresh_freq continue to change slightly.

In another test with only 6 servomotor services, all services except the first one stopped receiving data after 854 seconds of testing. After restarting the test without rebooting the system, the last 5 services stop receiving data after a couple seconds. Rebooting the Gate changed nothing, but rebooting the servomotor services allowed the system to work for several minutes before encountering the same issue.

title: [BUG] PyLuos bootloader fails on the last node of a network having exactly 25 nodes + Gate
description:
Which version the bug has been detected
Luos engine 2.5.2
Describe the bug
When exactly 25 nodes (in addition to the one hosting the gate and the pipe) are on the network, pyluos-bootloader fails to flash the last one of them (node ID 26), stopping at 3% of progress, when the nodes have just been flashed with the boot_service through a ST-LINK probe. This behaviour is always the same, no matter if I try to flash all nodes together or only the last node. I can reboot the network, switch the boards in the network, ..., it is always node with ID 26 that will be stuck at 3% of flashing.
If I isolate a subsection of the network, let's say nodes with ID 20 to 26, by disconnecting the rest of the boards, I can then flash all 7 boards normally. When I put this subsection back into the network, everything then works perfectly: I can reprogram the whole network using pyluos-bootloader.
Network configuration
The image below shows the network made of one Gate + Pipe (NUCLEO-G431KB with custom shield) and 25 custom nodes (STM32G431KB based), each one hosting one custom ServoMotor service.
The Gate + Pipe are powered through the USB cable. Each motor control node is powered (12 V regulated down to 3.3 V by each PCB) through the harness visible in the middle of the image (U shape).

title: [NEW FEATURE] Native support
description:
Why
Luos_engine is made to work in a bare metal embedded environment. So, to get started with this technology, you will need at least a computer and a supported dev board.
Find a board and plug it can be a drop condition for a new user.
The Native support goal is to allow people to test the technology without needing anything other than a computer.
This issue will be considered closed when all the training tutorials will be completely compatible with a Native target.
Constraints
The way things work has to be as close as it is when we use it on embedded targets.
We will have to keep the Luos_engine code base clean. No exception on this part of the code will be allowed. The only place where we can do native-specific things is on HAL and service code.
Here is a Global representation of Luos_engine layers :

Creating a Luos engine Core HAL will be straightforward. We only need a systick and can ignore Flash management for now because the bootloader is not part of the training tutorial yet.
Today, there is only one available network called Robus. This network has been thought to work on a half-duplex serial network, so we will have to create a native HAL for Robus to emulate this serial connection through TCP/IP.
We will have to create a specific native HAL (in green) like that :

Luos define a node as an MCU on the network. In the native target, we could have multiple binaries running on the same CPU; each running binary will be considered a node.
Used protocols
Data exchange
Robus rely on multipoint broadcast communication. Every message sent will be received by every node on the network simultaneously (by neglecting propagation time). We will have to emulate this by broadcasting information to every service available on the network.
We will use the WebSocket protocol to send and receive information. WebSocket will allow us to be future-proof and to make things run on web interfaces.
Discovering
Luos also need to be able to detect other nodes on the network. Robus use PTP lines to manage and find the topology. Those PTP lies allow us to daisy chain the nodes and to know which node is connected to which node, giving us a deterministic topology of the system.
Because native target nodes are binary and not physical parts, we can't use any physical specificities to create a deterministic topology. We will have to find another way.
For now, Luos and Robus are still highly coupled, and the way Luos works could be a problem for this detection feature. We will probably have to do some dirty hacks to make it work. This is ok only if we keep it on services and HAL.
Mdns is massively used to declare a service on a TCP/IP network. We could use that.
Pear to Pear libraries seems to be able to discover pears and create a list sorted by "distance". This list could be deterministic... Those libs also deal with pear data exchange.
Development steps
Before a complete setup, we must be able to compile a minimal Luos_engine binary working on a native target.
Step 1:
So the first step will be to compile an example only using localhost (internal to the binary) communication.
This step has its issue with more details: #290
Step 2:
Then we can actually work on developing a native HAL able to communicate on the Robus HAL.
This step has its issue with more details: #291

title: [NEW FEATURE] Native step 2 : Multiple nodes running
description:
In this second step of the Native development, our goal is to be able to run multiple Luos_engine binaries (nodes) to be able to list them during detection, and to make them communicate. We consider the step 1 ( #290 ) as completed
Or final goal will be to have the button running on another node that the Gate and still be able to catch it on the pyluos side :

To do that, our main focus will be on the Robus HAL.
Communication
To exchange information it could be great to rely on WebSocket and to be able to broadcast to all off them information. For broadcasting we could use MQTT with a broadcast topic.
This part is open to contribution and brainstorming
Detection
We will need to find a way to list other services and to send them node ID. To send them Id we need to be able to send a non broadcast message. If We use MQTT each node could create a topic with it's node name allowing anyone to reach this specific service.
This part is open to contribution and brainstorming

title: [NEW FEATURE] Native step 1 :  Button + Gate + Pipe binary working with pyluos
description:
In this first step of the Native development, our goal is to create a relevant example proving that a single Luos binary (equivalent to a single node) can work with the existing tools available in the Luos ecosystem.
Example to develop
For this first example, we will create a binary with a Button, a Gate/Inspector, and a Pipe :

HAL
Luos_engine core HAL
In this HAL, we have to deal with systick and flash. We will avoid the flash functions for now because we don't need to support the bootloader feature yet. In the future, we could emulate the flash with a file and be able to execute it (see #289 ).
Robus HAL
For this first step, in this HAL, we only need to fake message transmissions. Other functions can be void.
Button
The button service will use the space key of the keyboard to change its state.
Gate and Inspector
Gate and Inspector are app services. They don't rely on any hardware. Meaning they can be compiled and work without any modifications.
Pipe
Gate/Inspector will use Pipe to exchange information with pyluos. We will have to make this Pipe use WebSocket instead of the classical Serial communication. This work will be usable for the development of the Robus Native HAL on step 2 of the native development.
Also, this Pipe could be able to declare itself on the network allowing pyluos to discover the available pipe on the network (see #288 )

title: [NEW FEATURE] BOOTLOADER app to update Bootloader
description:
What feature would you like to be included in Luos?
A recent demand, that could be also a really cool feature of the Luos bootloader, is to create a bootloader application, that will update the bootloader. In other words, imagine that we have flashed a bootloader at the beginning of the flash, and by using it we flash our applications in the next positions of flash. Every time that we want to update an application we use the bootloader to do it. But what if our bootloader is out-of-date and we want to update it? Till now we need to flash the new bootloader using serial usb.
In order to update the bootloader we need create an application that will do the same procedure with the bootloader and it will be flashed by the bootloader and placed in a next position of the flash. This application will be a bootloader. The gate will send it a command to reflash the basic bootloader in the beginning. Let me better explain myself with an image:

title: [NEW FEATURE] Global routing table need or not to be send
description:
What feature would you like to be included in Luos?
In many case, a node don't need to receive and store the global routing, for exemple if there is only driver services in the node.
Now, we have to design ram message buffer to the size of global RTB in the product! it's necessary, just to accept message at detection time even if you only have one service in a node and after this phase all the space in the message buffer is useless.
Solution :

Add in node structure a bit field with information on the node.
one of them must indicate if the node need to receive the global RTB

struct attribute((packed))
{     // NODE mode entry
struct attribute((packed))
{
uint16_t node_id : 12;  // Node id
uint16_t certified : 4; // True if the node have a certificate
};
uint16_t port_table[(MAX_ALIAS_SIZE + 2 + 2 + sizeof(uint8_t) - 2) / 2]; // Node link table
uint8_t Node_Info//Mask of flag information
};


In the mask field of Node_Info come from a define in node_config.h


At the of of a detection instead of sending the global routing table to all the node, the node who start the detction parse the global routing and the Node_Info bit field of each node to send or not the global routing table to the other node.


This way no need to filtering a spécial command in the reception just need to no send a global routing!

title: [BUG] Reception : Recep_DoubleAlloc() could not work well for messages of mode TYPE and MULTICAST
description:
** Which version the bug has been detected **
Luos engine 2.4.2
Describe the bug
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
The function Recep_DoubleAlloc() was made for the case of an inspector, and it double allocates memory for a service that has deactivated the filtering of messages. That is to say, a service has demanded to receive all the messages of a specif service, or every service. However in this function there is a case that we do not double allocate the message, if this message is indeed destined to this specific service.
To avoid double allocating the same message for the same service, we compare the ID of the filter disable service with the msg->header.target. This cannot work in case of messages of mode TYPE and MULTICAST because the target is not an ID.

title: [NEW FEATURE] Add the possibility of define APP_SIZE into project's node_config.h
description:
What feature would you like to be included in Luos?
We need to create a #define for the size of an application in number of sectors. So when the user uses a bootloader to flash an mcu, we will directly know the sector that the application is stored and the number of sectors used to store this application. This will be really useful for the flash Erase function.
Right now we assume that the Application binary is positioned after all the other bytes (bootloader, shared memory etc) and that we need to erase the last sectors in order to erase the application. This will not always be true, as the user has access to the parameters APP_ADDRESS, APP_ADDRESS_SECTOR, SHARED_MEMORY_SECTOR etc, so they can easily change the order of their position in flash. As a result it is not sure that the sectors we decide to erase in HAL do not contain data of the other partitions of memory, data that we may want to continue having stored.
By putting a default application size, and by motivating the user to redefine the size depending on their needs, we can reassure the well-functioning of Luos (and particularly in the case of a bootloader, that is the case that we erase some sectors of flash).

title: [NEW FEATURE] Deactivate the writing of aliases into Flash memory
description:
What feature would you like to be included in Luos?
An existing feature of Luos which is the subscription of aliases in flash memory should be deleted from Luos_engine, because it poses problems in the  writing of applications in flash and in the functionality of bootloader.
-Right now we reserve the last sector of the flash for the aliases that we may have defined, and that we may want to use in the future. However, it is not a functionality that is frequently needed by the users, and it is needed only in very specific projects (like in projects with numerous hot-pluged services of the same name, etc).
Problems:
->Up till now, as the aliases were saved in the last sector of flash, we didnt erase this sector. This causes a problem, if while using a bootloader we flash with an application binary that uses the last sector to be saved. For example a long binary application that takes maltiple sectors in order to be saved, or the example of NUCLEO-F410RB that we save directly the binary in the last flash sector. In other words, the flash of the application is not well-cleaned so the application upload fails.
->In the same condition with the previous problem, we can overwrite the aliases with an application, or we can overwrite some application bytes, with the aliases that are saved during the execution.
Solution
The best solution is to leave this feature in the users' decision. If users, developping a specific project, need to store the aliases of their services, they should write them into flash in the specific address that they want, into their user code.  So Luos will not handle the treatment of aliases, it will only change the alias in ram and it will not store it in flash.
The message of WRITE_ALIAS that may be sent by pyluos to the network in order to rename a service, should pass by Luos like before, so that Luos change the name of the service in the service structure, but it should also be transferred to the service. So if the user wants to stock this alias in flash, they can do it, otherwise the message will be dropped.
For the treatment of write alias message, as well as the writing of an alias in flash, it would be nice that we propose a tutorial, so that we could facilitate the process, and propose a solution for those that they need to use it.

title: [BUG] Cross compilation typedef struct __attribute__((__packed__))
description:
Describe the bug
between different compiler an enum won't take the same space in memory!
For example with gcc :
an enum take the size of :
-> uint8_t if enum < 255 uint16_t
-> uint16_t if enum > 255
etc
For example with ninja:
an enum always take the size of uint32_t:
So when we want to know the size of a structure for exemple, if there is a enum inside the size will be differente between compiler!
To patch this all the structure that contains a an enum as type of a variable must be replace by the real size of the enum:
For example:
typedef struct attribute((packed))
{
entry_mode_t mode;
union
...
Must be replace by
typedef struct attribute((packed))
{
uint8_t mode;//type entry_mode_t
union
...
That way Luos will be cross compiler compatible and we manage the size of structure in a better way

title: [NEW FEATURE] Move maximum of timestamp related code from HAL to engine
description:

ll_timestamp_t structure: In my point of view this should be on Luos, HAL should only allow getting back the current timestamp. Also the only value we need to have at a global level is start_offset. lower and higher timestamp are always calculated and we don't need to keep them.
LuosHAL_GetTimestamp: this one sounds good and should not take care about the start_offset if we consider this value as a Luos feature not related to hardware.

LuosHAL_StopTimestamp: If we consider the start_offset value as a Luos value this function should be on Luos side. Other values don't need to be global so no need to reset them.

title: change ID to be on 8 bits
description:
By passing ID in 8 bit instead of 12 we can change the header struct and save 1 byte on the header because we can save 4 bit in target and source field.
This allow us to check if the message is for us at the second byte and we don't need more than 256 module ID.

title: Type and Id liste compression to optimize research
description:
Currently during the reception of a message we have to loop on module table to find if we have a module concerned by this messages. This loop take time and have to be executed in IRQ...
To save some time defining if this message is for us or not we could check it by using masks on compressed datas of hosted modules in the node.
To do that the Id or Type value represent a bit decay on a specific buffer containing compressed datas of modules hosted in a node. To check if a message is for us we just have to decay a bit from the ID or TYPE received and compare it with the local compressed values we have.
